On 5/22/13 12:21 PM, stjiggyfly wrote:
> Just as a test I am trying to define my user agent for Heritrix
> 1.14.4 and Heritrix 3.1 as a mobile user agent so that it will
> receive back mostly just mobile web pages. However, no matter what I
> seem to try it says that my user-agent is not valid or when it does
> accept my mobile user agent...it just straight up doesn't work.
>
> I went to see how the googlebot-mobile was doing it and adapted a
> user agent from it:
>
> Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; U; CPU iPhone OS 4_1 like Mac OS X; en-us)
> AppleWebKit/532.9 (KHTML, like Gecko Version/4.0.5 Mobile/8B117
> Safari/6531 .22.7 (compatible; heritrix/1.14.4 +MY_URL_HERE)
>
> Where MY_URL_HERE is set to the URL of the University where I work.
>
> When it does accept the user agent above it does nothing different.
> It detects some mobile web pages (which is does regardless), but the
> way I need it is to crawl mostly just mobile web pages.
>
> Can anyone tell if I am doing something wrong?

What 'not valid' error specifically are you getting?

Note that Heritrix 3 expects the configured userAgentTemplate property 
to include the literal placeholder fragment "@OPERATOR_CONTACT_URL@". 
The contact URL is provided in another property, operatorContactUrl. 
That URL is then substituted into the template to create the actual sent 
'User-Agent' value.

(Also note that the URL's purpose is to allow you and your specific 
crawling project to be understood and contacted; a broad institutional 
URL won't help webmasters troubled by your crawling reach you.)

Crawling with a mobile user-agent is an excellent idea, but whether or 
not any website offers you alternate content is up to that site's own 
server-side logic. Any site might be very finicky about User-Agents or 
even use some other form of detection (in-page Javascript) or display 
adaptation (eg: CSS 'media queries'). So why your User-Agent might not 
get mobile-specific content on any particular site would require 
case-by-case analysis.

- Gordon
